text:
*Trigger the notifications as new*:
`ddev drush php:eval "\Drupal::service('user.data')->delete('announcements_feed');drupal_flush_all_caches();"`

If you want to *test another feed URL*, for example the one on the tests, you need to override the feed_url:
• Copy `sites/example.settings.local.php` to `sites/default/settings.local.php`
• Uncomment the last three lines of `sites/default/settings.php` to include the above file
• Edit the `sites/development.services.yml` and add `announcements_feed.feed_url: <https://drupal.ddev.site/core/modules/announcements_feed/tests/announce_feed/community-feeds.json>` to the `parameters` section (replace `<http://drupal.ddev.site|drupal.ddev.site>` with the URL of the testing environment)
• `ddev drush php:eval "\Drupal::service('user.data')->delete('announcements_feed');\Drupal::service('keyvalue.expirable')->get('announcements_feed')->deleteAll();drupal_flush_all_caches();"`

If you want to *test another feed URL*, for example the one on the tests, you need to override the feed_url:
• Copy `sites/example.settings.local.php` to `sites/default/settings.local.php`
• Uncomment the last three lines of `sites/default/settings.php` to include the above file
• Edit the `sites/development.services.yml` and add `announcements_feed.feed_url: <https://drupal.ddev.site/core/modules/announcements_feed/tests/announce_feed/community-feeds.json>` to the `parameters` section (replace `<http://drupal.ddev.site|drupal.ddev.site>` with the URL of the testing environment)
• `ddev drush php:eval "\Drupal::service('user.data')->delete('announcements_feed');\Drupal::service('keyvalue.expirable')->get('announcements_feed')->deleteAll();drupal_flush_all_caches();"`

text:
Not sure if it’s an intended side effect, but any organisation could have their own custom feed that, as long as it follows the format of <https://www.drupal.org/announcements.json|this one>, could be set to their sites (or the sites they build).

ie: a government or university might want to create a feed and have all their sites read from that feed instead of the d.o one. It’d be a one line change in the services file to overwrite `announcements_feed.feed_url`.
